content.rendered:
Originally from Indiana, Sarah and Austin traveled from their current home in Florida to tie the knot with an elegant, natural wedding on a rainy day in Nashville.

"Austin is in the military, so we’ve been away from family for a while," Sarah told us. "It was super nice to have everyone in one place to celebrate together."

Even though it didn't look promising at first, the weather cleared right up just in time for the ceremony at the beautiful Cheekwood Estate & Gardens.

Afterward, everyone made their way to an elegant, natural wedding reception at The Bridge Building.

A neutral palette paired perfectly with effortlessly placed greenery, creating an elegant feel in the Cumberland space. And Austin's mom designed all the florals! Needless to say, we were seriously impressed.

As guests sat down to dinner, Infinity grilled peach salads were already waiting. They perused a delectable buffet including southern favorites such as house hickory smoked pulled pork and hot chicken breast with biscuits and southern slaw.

With dinner underway, the couple danced to "Greatest Love Story" by Lanco, a song Sarah says is totally reflective of her and Austin's relationship.

After an epic dance party, guests saw the couple off as they went to Broadway to continue the party late into the night.

Scroll on for more from this elegant, natural wedding.

WEDDING DETAILS

Date: September 9, 2018
Bride & Groom: Sarah and Austin
Ceremony: Cheekwood Estate
Reception: The Bridge Building
Guest Count: 62
Colors: Neutrals & Greenery
Photographer: Taylor N. Photography
Paper Goods: Minted
Florist: Mother of the Groom!
Cake: Publix
Linens: Liberty Party Rental
Band: For A Good Time Call
Bar & Catering: The Bridge Building
Production Design: Infinity Hospitality
Planning: Emily O. | IH

excerpt.rendered: An elegant, natural summer wedding reception at The Bridge Building.
